The soldiers of Antony were soon started in pursuit. They overtook Cicero near Formiae, where his head was sev- ered from his body by the bravo Popilius. The hands were cut off, and the murderers carried them, with the head, to Antony, who caused them (in mockery of his triumphs in eloquence,) to be nailed to the rostra ς while Fulvia, the widow of Clodius and the wife of Antonius, pierced with her needle the tongue which had dared to declaim against) both her husbands.
